intro: Mesosphaerum nitidulum, commonly known as the smooth globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Mesosphaerum nitidulum is adapted to arid conditions, with deep roots that help it survive in low-water environments.
